alert.note: Alert for Butler; Clermont; Clinton; Fayette; Greene; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:29AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER, NORTHERN CLERMONT, WARREN, NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE, CLINTON AND SOUTHERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM EDT... At 129 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bellbrook to Wyoming, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Mason, Xenia, Lebanon, Sharonville, Wilmington, Blue Ash, Loveland, Reading, Montgomery, Wyoming, Blanchester, Finneytown, Waynesville, Sabina, Jamestown, Jeffersonville, Morrow, Highpoint, Kings Island and Sixteen Mile Stand. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 15 and 73. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 13 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
